t: Job 29
Job’s Summary Defense
And*p Job again took up his discourse, and said:
“Oh,*pn that I were as in the months of old, as*ld in the days when God watched over me,
when*ln his lamp shone upon my head, and*ld by his light I walked through darkness,
as*ln I was in my prime, when*ld the friendship of God was upon my tent,
when*ln the Almighty was yet with me, when*ld my children were all around me,
when*ln my steps were washed with butter, and*ld the rock poured out for me streams of oil!
When*ln I went out to the gate of the city, when*ld I prepared my seat in the square,
the*ln young men saw me and withdrew, and*ld the aged rose and stood;
the*ln princes refrained from talking and*ld laid their hand on their mouth;
the*ln voice of the nobles was hushed, and*ld their tongue stuck to the roof of their mouth.
When*ln the ear heard, it called me blessed, and*ld when the eye saw, it approved,
because*ln I delivered the poor who cried for help, and*ld the fatherless who had none to help him.
The*ln blessing of him who was about to perish came upon me, and*ld I caused the widow’s heart to sing for joy.
I*ln put on righteousness, and it clothed me; my*ld justice was like a robe and a turban.
I*ln was eyes to the blind and*ld feet to the lame.
I*ln was a father to the needy, and*ld I searched out the cause of him whom I did not know.
I*ln broke the fangs of the unrighteous and*ld made him drop his prey from his teeth.
Then*ln I thought, ‘I shall die in my nest, and*ld I shall multiply my days as the sand,
my*ln roots spread out to the waters, with*ld the dew all night on my branches,
my*ln glory fresh with me, and*ld my bow ever new in my hand.’
“Men*pn listened to me and waited and*ld kept silence for my counsel.
After*ln I spoke they did not speak again, and*ld my word dropped upon them.
They*ln waited for me as for the rain, and*ld they opened their mouths as for the spring rain.
I*ln smiled on them when they had no confidence, and*ld the light of my face they did not cast down.
I*ln chose their way and sat as chief, and*ld I lived like a king among his troops, like*ld one who comforts mourners.
